column1: Little Goat Diner////I've been here twice: once for brunch
column2: once for dinner. The atmosphere lends itself more to brunch. At night
column3: they just dim the lights a LOT to make it dinner-like. The menu has everything
column4: but leans toward lunch and brunch. Â The food is really good
column6: too. Standard items like a club
column10: but all with a flavor twist that works well. Fat Elvis waffles were amazing-what's not to like about bacon
column11: bananas and peanut butter butter? Fries were thin and tasty for the table. Nothing like Girl and The Goat
column12: but also quality food. $17 + tip valet stinks
column13: but that area is ridiculous to find free parking. Love the West Loop for dining...
